New Records: Jhonkensy Noel hit a seismic home run, the one that lost the Yankees' lead, the one that pushed them from the verge of a pennant into an actual, competitive ALCS with the Cleveland Guardians.
Key Match Events: Lane Thomas doubled off the left-field wall
David Fry's two-run blast off Clay Holmes in the 10th inning
Aaron Judge's laser-beam homer off Emmanuel Clase tied the score in the eighth
Pre-Game Insights: The Yankees' manager emphasized the importance of strong bullpen performance
The Guardians' formula of 'bunts, bombs and chaos' was expected to be a key factor in the game
Post-Match Reflections: Aaron Judge expressed pride in the team's resilience after the comeback win
Aaron Boone, the Yankees' manager, called it a classic and amazing game to witness
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Yankees still have the series lead, with two more games here and two more, if necessary, in the Bronx
The Guardians' bullpen has looked mortal, with a 3.80 ERA this postseason
Others: The game was a classic example of baseball at its best, with superstars and bench guys taking turns playing hero
The Yankees should know better than to dwell on the loss
